sub_033_ecology_02:
Thanks for taking on all those Tera Raid Battles
for us![npcn:2A]
sub_033_ecology_03:
[BD06:0]Our investigation is moving along thanks to you,
[trnm:0]—we have some new data.[npcn:2A]
sub_033_ecology_04:
It seems that Terastal energy is released from
the Great Crater of Paldea from time to time,\r
and that’s having an effect on the crystals.[npcn:2A]
sub_033_ecology_05:
Tera Raid crystals that get hit by especially strong
blasts of this energy are apparently transforming\r
into [clr:6]black crystals[clr:0].[npcn:2A]
sub_033_ecology_06:
The Tera Pokémon found at these black crystals
are incredibly powerful...[npcn:2A]
sub_033_ecology_07:
So much so that average Trainers wouldn’t stand
a chance against them.[npcn:2A]
sub_033_ecology_08:
[BD06:0]You’re anything but average, but I’m afraid this is
too dangerous—even for you,\r
[trnm:0].[npcn:2A]
sub_033_ecology_09:
Even if you find the location of one of these
black crystals on your map app, please do NOT—\r
I repeat—DO NOT take on the Tera Raid there![npcn:2A]
sub_033_ecology_10:
Hmmm... You almost seem a little TOO willing to
agree.[npcn:2A]
sub_033_ecology_11:
I mean it! Don’t read into that like there’s some
kind of hidden meaning![npcn:2A]
sub_033_ecology_12:
Sorry for getting you involved in this only to ask
you to step away, but...\c
Whatever you do, do NOT go looking for these
black crystals![npcn:2A]
sub_033_ecology_13:
I’m counting on you to make the right choice
here![npcn:2A]
